cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles ESE of Caibarien, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest later today, skirt the north coast of Cuba, cross the Florida Keys Sunday morning, move up the southwest coast of Florida Sunday afternoon, then lift north-northwest into Georgia/Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys Sunday morning, then near Naples/Marco Island on the southwest Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Fernandina Beach (includes Jacksonville)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the Florida peninsula to Anclote River, Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee, Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, Keys, and the Georgia coast
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (79%) of tropical-storm-force winds reaching Jacksonville late Sunday night; moderate chance (37%) of 50-kt winds; small (15%) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Watch in effect north of Volusia/Brevard line suggests 2–4 ft of surge is possible along the northeast Florida coast and St. Johns River near Jacksonville.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain possible across the Florida peninsula and into southeast Georgia, including Jacksonville, with flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; dangerous surf and rip currents impacting port approaches.
